Thanks again for your helpful feedback, we all look forward to your next visit with us.  Sincerely, The Management Staff at Pointe Estero Beach Resort

title: Kind of old but nice.....
review: We stay here or next door at Gull Wing every year due to their location on the southern part of Estero Island.  The condo is fine and the balconies are screened.  Management will provide a device to allow for wireless connection in the condo.   There are a few design flaws, one, a  curtainless window from the master bath into the master bedroom.  This is not great if one person uses the facilities in the middle of the night and the other person is sensitive to light in their eyes.  Two, the master bath tub/shower is a huge family- size jacuzzi  with no curtain to contain the water that comes from the shower.  The shower controls are very difficult to reach.  I would only recommend this for agile, young adults.  We only used the second bedroom's bath tub/shower combo the whole…

title: Great for a family vacation
review: Dear Ivywood,  Thank your for taking the time to review our Pointe Estero Beach Resort property and our guest services. Our staff takes great pride in their high standard of work and, they are always striving to serve our guests with the highest level of customer service and products available.  We are sorry we did not meet all your expectations. Please know that Pointe Estero is always looking to exceed our guest's experience and to making improvements that make our guest's stay as comfortable as possible.  Thanks again for your feedback. We hope to serve you again in the future.   Sincerely, The Management Staff at Pointe Estero Beach Resort

title: Relaxing and Peaceful
review: We stayed here for 1 week at the end of June. We paid xtra for beachfront high floor so the view was very nice. The condo was nice, clean and kind of old fashion. The kitchen was fully furnished which was nice. We went to publix and were able to make food for the week. There is no cleaning service at this condo so if u want ur room cleaned, bed made etc u hv to pay extra. Our first night the sheets in the master bed were so rough and itchy we could hardly sleep. The next day they changed them for us but we could not seem to get xtra pillows. No matter how many times i called they said ok and never brought them. The beach is nice, soft sand and it is a walk from the condo but so what, u get some exercise! Having a total ocean view was great and sleeping at night to the sound of…

title: Great family week at Pointe Estero
review: We just stayed this past week at Pointe Estero from 7/16-7/21. Our family of 4, two daughters ages 16 and 20 with us. We have stayed here before several times, but it's been a few years.  We had a wonderful time!  Because I have been here before, and we were coming from Ft. Lauderdale (only 2 hours away) we came very prepared.  We brought food, movies, board games, beach balls (Pro Kadima beach paddle ball, volleyball, football), our own beach chairs and umbrellas.  We were set for our own entertainment.  My husband and I were so happy with our experience....long walks as a family, one funny "family" bubble bath in the HUGE jacuzzi master tub (all 4 of us fit!), outdoor barbecuing, playing beach paddle ball on the beach, collecting shells, playing Pictionary at night...lots of…

title: Shocking!
review: We used to stay here every year before it became a "resort" but decided to stop one night for old times sake.  What a disappointment.  For starters, the parking lot was full of cars belonging to visitors of other guests - no spaces for PAYING guests and nobody cared.  We stayed in a penthouse with worn furnishings and a mattress so saggy it was ridiculous.  Topping it off, ANTS EVERYWHERE.  Sorry our memories of this place were tarnished by what it's become.

title: Perfectly fine, but would not stay here again.
review: Dear MsCheap1,  Thank you for your feedback, I appreciate hearing from you and apologize for any inconveniences during your stay. To address your concerns, we do only provide two parking spaces per reservation to assure our guests and owners have a place to park. I only regret guest services was not made aware of this during your stay as we would have made every effort in helping you. As for the furnishings, we just recently replaced our chairs and ottoman in the living room as of 1 month ago. The dining room chairs and barstools are all newly reupholstered. We are also scheduled to have the sofa sleeper replaced as well this year.   We were recently informed about the ants and have since treated the areas.   I assure you that each guest’s comfort is a very important aspect of our success. I hope that this past experience does not mar your overall view of our resort and that we will have a future opportunity to host your next visit to Fort Myers Beach.  Warm Regards,  The Pointe Estero Management Team

title: We had a great time here.
review: Stayed one night for a big family reunion-type weekend. Had the two bedroom condo which consists of a large bedroom with king size bed + large bath with huge jacuzzi tub inside, bedroom with two twin beds and ample space for a crib + the kitchen and dining and living room area, that has a sleeper sofa. Two screened balconies are nice, although I don't know that I would pay extra for the beach view we had. Lobby area is said to have wi-fi but only two or three single chairs about so not a welcoming place to lounge at all. Otherwise, wi-fi is extra. Free coffee in the "lobby" though, until around 10am (?). Oh, but the "lobby" area and all the hallways upstairs have no a/c so waiting for elevators or getting your free coffee downstairs means you may break a sweat; good news is you…

title: A Gem
review: This was our first visit to Fort Myers, but we have traveled quite a bit.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in a one bedroom condo on the 9th floor.  We did not pay for ocean front but we had a great view of the ocean and the bay.  We could not have asked for more.  Some things in the unit could have been repaired or replaced like some of the appliances and kitchen faucet but overall it was a great time.  We would definitely stay here again.  The only thing that did get tiring was the walk out to the water as the beach is very expansive at this point.

title: Extremely Poor Customer Service & A Disappointing Experience
review: In all the years that I have ever travelled within the US, and stayed at Hotels, which is appomixately 35 years, this was my poorest experience in both value and customer service that I have ever experienced.  My girlfriend had stayed at Pointe Estero several times in the past with her family and made the initial recommendation.  For as much money as I was charged per night, given the problems we experienced and customer service that we received, I was thoroughly disappointed.  Right after the trip, I even took the time to write a very lengthly email explaining what was wrong with both our room and the resort, so that management could correct the problems we noted. Both the Corporate Office as well as Pointe Esterro Beach Resort Property Management were not even willing to…

title: Love this rental condo!
review: Dear Joe,  Thank you again for sharing your experience with us. We are terribly sorry for any inconveniences or deficiencies in our service levels that were experienced when you were a guest with us. I assure you that each guest’s comfort is a very important aspect of our success and we are saddened to hear our initial apology was not satisfactory. Thank you again for your comments. We are truly sorry to have not met and exceeded your expectations.  We hope to have another chance to welcome you back to Pointe Estero Beach Resort in the future and give us the opportunity to change your perception of us.  Warm Regards,  Pointe Estero Beach Resort Management Team

title: Loved this hotel!
review: This was our second stay and loved it . We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath (one with a huge jacuzzi tub), full size kitchen, eating area, 3 televisions, free internet, and washer and dryer in unit.,  All the balconies are screened in and have gulf views.   The beach is on site and you can rent chairs and umbrellas.  Staff very friendly and accommodating.   Pool is a decent size and nice pool deck with chaise, chairs and tables.  It's a great place for families and couples.

title: Wonderful Experience!
review: We really loved this hotel! The rooms have everything you could ever need. All off the balcony's are somewhat facing the ocean and the beach couldn't be closer. Only thing is that it's quite a walk to the actual sea because the beach is that wide! ;) If we ever go back to Fort Myers Beach we will definitely stay here again!

title: loved this place!
review: I recently returned from Point Estero Beach Resort (June 2 -5) with my daughter and 3 grandchildren. We had a 2 bedroom-2 bath condo with a beautiful view of the Gulf. The condo was equipped with a full kitchen including a dishwasher and washer and dryer. These were great to have with 3 kids and their wet towels and swimsuits!  The condo had a full screened in balcony that was accessable from both bedrooms and the livingroom. The master suite had a huge whirlpool tub which the kids thought was almost as fun as the swimming pool! The resort grounds were always clean and I was impressed with the layout of the property. I've seen people write that this resort was walking distance to the Publix grocery store.....it's not! It's at best a 5 minute drive! The front desk people were…

title: Would come back for sure.
review: Condo on the beach with everything you need; washer/dryer, kitchen, huge whirlpool tub. Very clean. Great pool, great staff.

title: My 2nd home
review: I've being coming here for 10 years now, at least once a year, I love this place, spacious, everything very nice and clean, the layout of each condo it's perfect, fully equipped with washer/dryer, full spacious kitchen, a beautiful master bedroom beachfront (if you reserve a beachfront suite) nice beach front balcony, the pool area and reception is very nice, the bbq area, the white sandy beach with dolphins, jet-ski rentals, beach volleyball and tennis courts everything is perfect!! <3 I absolutely love this place, my family vacations and reunions are always here.

title: Very Happy, it was more than I expected!
review: I purchased this deal on living social. I am so happy I did! I needed a get away and this place was perfect. It sits right on the beach. Although the room was not technically an "Ocean View"u, it still had a great view of the beach! There are plenty of windows and a huge wrap around porch that offers a really nice area to relax. The staff was friendly. There is no restaurant or room service, it is a condo, not  a hotel. But we were able to order some delivery from one of the restaurants close by and it was great! Highly recommend! The kitchen was fully stocked, they do give you samples of detergent and dish washer soap, so if you plan on staying a while I suggest you run down to publix and buy a little. We had no issues with our bedding or blankets. I guess every room is…

title: Great place!
review: I was here with my family with 4 children. This place is really great! Nice pool, close to the beach, apartment is big enough, clean and with everything that is needed. I love this place and would have loved to stay longer here. Highly recommended!

title: Great place to stay (I just wish check out was later)
review: We had a GREAT, although short, stay at Pointe Estero. I am already planning to come back with our family! We stayed in Room 501 and it was a 2 bedroom unit with one King bed and the other bedroom had 2 twin beds. The layout was GREAT and the view was wonderful! I called ahead to request a higher level so we had a great view and we did have a nice view of the beach! The beach area is quiet and beautiful and there weren't a lot of people there at sunset.   The ONLY downside was the 10 am check out time. That's CRAZY! They did allow us a later check out time of 11:00.   Fort Myers Beach (Time Square area) was about a 5 minute cab ride. After we went to a few bars that night, there were cabs parked at a gas station and we paid $10 to get back to our hotel.   I look forward to…

title: Great Place for Vacation
review: This is a beautiful resort on a really nice beach. We have stayed in the area before and decided to give Fort Myers Beach a try. We booked 9 days at the Point Estero.  We were really  impressed when we arrived and checked in to our condo.  Very spacious living, great fully equipped kitchen, very nice having the extra bathroom, and they have  a first class pool and hot tub area.  The beach is huge.  Also I was really impressed with the convenience of everything like the grocery store, restaurants, ice cream, shopping, all within walking distance or a real short drive.

title: Awesome resort
review: This resort is perfect for family stay or just an adult getaway. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly and views from balcony are amazing. Highly recommend this resort for your next visit to SW Florida coast.

title: Very nice, clean, highly recommended
review: My family stayed there during 2012 College spring break. My two "kids" are now two men in their 20's. We went there hoping for a relaxing 5 night stay. We got exactly what we wanted. The resort is located about 5 miles south of the main Fort Myers beach so we were not stuck in traffic every time we left the place.  Room is nicely equipped and clean. The beach is very wide, about a football field, and requires a somewhat of a walk to get to the shore. But it never bothered me, it's a private beach, so who cares. You can even play a softball game there. You can bring your beach chairs or rent the ones on the beach. Beach is very clean and groomed.  Parking is free and you are within walking distance of numerous restaurants and shops. Or you can drive, parking is plentiful. I would…

title: Great beach condo hotel
review: This is a good beach condo resort in a peaceful part of Fort Myers Beach.  The 2 bed/2 bath condo was very spacious and met our needs.  We loved the full balcony that wrapped around the side of the condo with 4 ways to enter & exit.  The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.  The pool was much more spacious than most pools at other resorts.  The beach is very wide which made it roomy with all of the visitors on the beach.  We did however have a few complaints.  Only one elevator was working during our week stay and it had been down for several days before our arrival, so you spent a lot of time waiting for the one elevator.  We had to have our room keys re-keyed several times as they did not open the doors easily. After the second time we just had to keep trying the…

title: Good again!
review: Dear Lovetotravel099,  I am very pleased to read that you will be back to visit us at Pointe Estero Beach Resort. We strive to make every guest’s experience a pleasant stay away from home and we look forward to welcoming you back; thank you for your comments regarding our hotel facilities and service levels. We apologize that one of our elevators was temporarily out of service during your stay as well as their being difficulty with your room keys. As this isn’t a common concern, we understand that it was an inconvenience during your stay and are greatly appreciative of your understanding. Thank you again for your review.  We hope to see you back soon!  Sincerely, The Management Team at Pointe Estero Beach Resort

title: We were happy!
review: We rented the 1 bedroom condo gulf view.  It was very spacious and we had a perfect view.  We were on the 3rd floor.  The condo is two bedroom but they locked the 2nd bedroom but they still give you the 2nd bathroom.  The jacuzzi tub was huge!  We could lay down in it.  The kitchen was great and had a lot of utensils and extras.  Very clean condo with the exception of a small ant problem.  We could kill about 2-3 each time we went into the kitchen.  Porches are screened and huge.  Great area to sit and eat breakfast or lunch.  One other small con was that we could hear the people above us.  The pool was spacious and the landscaping was very pretty on the resort.  The beach was very nice and there were lots of very good restaurants with in a short walking distance.  We recommend…

title: Absolutely awesome place to stay!
review: We would not have changed one thing about our stay at Pointe Estero Beach Resort....well yes we would...we should have stayed longer.  We have been home a week and I am so ready to go back.  We had two bedroom condo looking over the gulf......rooms were spacious and clean.  We will be back!

title: Even better than last year!
review: This was our second vacation at Pointe Estero Beach Resort and it was fantastic!  The Condo is so clean, large, and well stocked with a start up package (paper towels, S&P, Tide, dish & dishwasher detergent, coffee and sugar packets).  The views are spectacular of the gulfs sunsets and the beach. Publix's supermarket is a short drive from the property and there is a CVS, restaurants, hardware store, and clothing stores within walking distance from the hotel.  They have the best staff of any hotel that we have ever been to...Ibraham, Jamey, and Jennifer are so nice and accommodating...as well as Mark, the Manager.  Enrico is always there to help with packages and anything else you would need him to do for you.  Everyone makes you feel special and you can tell its because they…

title: going back!
review: I wrote a great review last year after spending a wonderful vacation at the Pointe Estero .... and am so happy to say we just booked another trip for this Spring.  One thing I found out .... in calling the Pointe Estero reservations directly, they matched a lower price which we had found on both Orbitz and Expedia (which were offering a special discount for 3+ night stays).   Since I always prefer to deal directly with the hotel, this made me very happy.

title: JUST GREAT!!!!!
review: My wife and I stayed at this resort from Jan 28/2012-Jan 30/2012 to celebrate our 21 wedding aniversary and since our arrival we both noticed the great service on the resort. Every employee was ready to provide the best to make us feeling special, our unit was excellent, with an incredible gulf view and extremly clean and well equipped, Oleg (front desk staff)was very polide and help us with every question and also he run an extra mile helping to our friend to get a last minute deal at another resort at an excellent price. It is simply a really good example of an Excellent customer service.

title: Excellent location and view
review: Upon arrival, we were told that our requests (baby high chair, crib and a room high up with gulf view) had not been forwarded by our travel agency. This was not the hotel's fault,  however, rather some intermediate's. We got the stuff we requested after five minutes, except that we ended up on the second floor because it was full. And full it was -of ants! We were told not to leave any food exposed and wipe off any water that might be spilled. On the second day, we got a room on the 11th floor after paying about $ 250 extra for the nine nights we were staying. It was definetely worth every cent. The room offered a view of the fantastic beach, and we had sea view from the other side of the apartement as well. The apartment was spacious and we loved the screened balcony because we…

title: Evcellent Condos!
review: We stayed at this resort from 30Th November till 4Th December and thought the accommodation was excellent! On arrival and throughout our stay the reception staff did all they could to make our visit special (they even delivered a wi-fi unit to allow Internet access from anywhere in the apartment). We requested a high floor and again we were pleased to find ourselves on the second top floor) with fantastic views, especially the sunset!  Will definitely return again if ever in the area!

title: Most of the Comforts of Home
review: We found this condo on Trip Advisor and made reservations based on the number of favourable reviews.  We booked a suite with gulf views but was hard pressed to see much of the beach from our balcony.  The front desk informed us that only suites titled beach front views actually got the good views.  They offered us a suite in thier sister building which had a much better view for the same price but we declined it due to the older nature of that suite.  The condo was decently appointed and well furnished.  It was great to be able to cook a meal and relax in the jacuzzi tub afterwards.  The beach was fabulous even though it was cool during our stay we still walked down every evening to watch the sun set.  There's a Publix supermarket up the road for groceries and a little further…

title: Exceptional
review: This hotel has it all: Great location, right on the beautiful beach. Spacious, luxury rooms. I can't think of any drawbacks

title: Our Vacation was Salvaged!
review: We booked a condo down the street and when we found out that the pool closed as dusk (5:30pm in December).  However we were never told that before we paid for the condo a month earlier.  We spent the night at Point Estero Beach Resort and when we found out the pool was opened until 10pm along with the hot tub and the fitness room we contacted the condo owner at Carlos Point Beach Club # 523 and told her we could not stay at her condo if the pool closed up at dusk and locked up tight because we and our children came to Ft Myers, Florida to swim and sun and relax not sit in a condo after the pool and rec room closed up at dusk and then contacted the front desk at Point Estero to see if they could help us out with a room at a rate we could afford since we had already spent over…

title: Pointe Estero Beach Resort
review: The hotel was great, accomodations very nice: full kitchen, two bathrooms, one bedroom, large living room, and a large, beautiful screened balcony with terrific Gulf and Beach views. reasonable price for what you get. The beach was the best part: huge wide beach, several minutes walk from hotel to water's edge because it is the widest beach on the island. Fantastic soft white sand, and very pleasant water for swimming, very gradual depth increase so very nice for families with small children. Drawbacks were that the beach cabanas and beach umbrellas are $25 per day, and no special discount for hotel guests (vendor is separate from hotel). But hotel has some beach chairs and small umbrellas that prior guests have left there, that they keep by the pool for anyone to borrow and use…

title: Since 20 years the same high standard
review: Twenty years ago we have found the place by accident. Since then we return regularly and have found the place well managed and kept. The apartments are spacious, clean and everything works. Not to forget the views. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. A true home from home.

title: Pointe Estero Resort was just what we had expected
review: We stayed here from 10 - 21st October 2011 . Following a 45 minute drive from RSW Airport we arived at reception at around 9pm and we were met by Ibrahim who was very welcoming. He made sure we knew all we needed to and checked us in promptly. We were allocated Room 603 which was a one bedroom suite. The suite was huge with lots of drawer and hanging space and the facilities were excellent and would suit anyone who wanted to feel at home away from home! All mod cons were provided with the only exception being a kettle but that wasn't a big issue. The location right on the beach was ideal as was the pool area. There was plenty of on-site parking. As there were just the 2 of us we did our own daily clean up although we could have paid extra for that service. The resort provided a…

title: 5-day getaway
review: This place is just as advertised.  The staff was great. Our room key didnt work and so they upgraded us. Abraham was great the entire stay (of 5 nights) he was always willing to assist. The resort is right on the beach and the room was clean and large. The only drawback is the resort is not close enough to walk to any eating or shopping. But my wife and I enjoyed the time together. We will come back again sometime next year.

title: Great resort right on the beach.
review: My husband and I stayed at the Pointe Estero Resort for a short weekend trip to Florida (Thursday-Sunday). I did lots of research online and looked into Neptune, Gullwing and Diamond head but decided on Pointe Estero and it was a great choice! We booked through hotels.com and got a rate of $130 a night, which was cheaper than the other internet websites. We arrived after the resort office was closed so we called in advance to let them know and were given a code to get into a box that had our key and room information....had no problems at all. The resort is very nice. The room itself had a living room, full kitchen, dining area, two bathroom (one of which had a HUGE jacuzzi tub), and a great screened in balcony with a beautiful view of the beach. The pool area is sufficient, I've…

title: Family vacation
review: This was a our first time visting Fort Myers Beach. We chose this property at the last minute. It was absolutely wonderful! Condo was very clean.  Kitchen was well equipped --- if you choose to cook. Having screened balcony was Great. The desk help was extremely pleasant and helpful in suggestions for our kids. Even though this resort is a few miles from Time Sqaure the trolley stops right in front of property--- I'm quite sure we will revisit again soon. We stayed on the second floor which was a patial side view of beach. Nice view but would maybe a few floors higher would make it even nicer.  If youa re lookign fro total entertainemnt for kids this might not be the place.  It has kid activites but limited. This did not stop our kids from having a awesome time-----Beach/Time…

title: 2 bedroom beach resort nice!
review: Stayed with the family in June.  It is a very nice condo.  My mom is actually a tightwad motel 6 kind of person.  Nothing against Motel 6, I am sure they are just fine.  When we got to the condo they went ahead to the room while I parked the car.  When I got to the condo mom had tears in her eyes said it was the nicest place she had ever stayed.  She went out on the Lanai and could not believe the view.  Keep in mind it is a condo.  No house keeping.  The plus is it has full kitchen, washer dryer, one of the biggest jacuzzi tubs I have ever seen.  It was open and you could take a shower without getting the floor wet crazy.  I did not like that the water was probably 100 yards from the back of the hotel.  The sand it white and it didn't get  to hot so the walk wasn't bad.  Nice…

title: Great spot, right on the beach
review: Got a great deal through Travelzoo!  The resort is at the quieter end of Fort Myers Beach, but that was fine with us.  At this time of year, it was no problem heading back up to the Times Square area at night for dinner and drinks and finding a place to park.  Jennifer at the check-in desk was very warm and welcoming, and we were very pleased with the third floor unit we in.  We had a full kitchen with granite countertops, a large lanai overlooking the beach, internet access, large bedroom, and the biggest jetted tub that I've ever seen in the master bathroom!  The resort is located on a lovely, wide stretch of beach, and there were chairs and umbrellas available to rent.  Being "locals," we brought our own from home, and had no problem picking them up out of our car and…

title: Great location, small units.
review: Well, what can Monte say. In regards to the actual physical location, perfection! The building itself is dated. Low ceilings make for a unpleasant experience. Monte stayed in one of the high floor, full gulf front 2 bdr units. Great view, but again, very dated. The pool was nice. It was rather large, and the temperature was just right. After touring the sister property next door, Monte would have to recommend the Gullwing instead. Monte did enjoy using the screened balcony at night for extra-curricular activities though! Slept well then.

title: Just perfection!
review: From the moment we pulled up it was lovely. Ibraham was so fantastic when we checked in. It's on the beach with huge space to stay in. Fabulous views and massive balcony. So good we added 3 more nights as didn't want to leave

title: Great Place and Friendly People
review: We had done many hours of looking on trip advisor for a place to stay in fort Myers beach. We always came back to Pointe Estero beach resort. I am on disability and we are on a fixed income, fixed really low,ha. We called and booked our vacation and prayed that it would be what we hoped for. When we arrived we were greeted by the staff, which were very friendly. The room was very large beautiful and very clean. The view from the balcony was great. We had stayed on Clearwater Beach , St. Petersburg Beach and Sand Key before but this had to be the best placed that we had ever stayed. The only down side to this vacation was that all the resturant's close up at 9:00 or 10:00 pm. the whole beach seems to go to bed . I want to thank everybody at Pointe Estero Beach resort for making…

title: Lovely condos, fantastic views
review: Spent 3 nights here. Just lovely. Had gulf view but balcony also overlooked the beach. No complaints what so ever. Being able to rent dvds and borrow games was good. Lovely large and airy. Own washer & dryer was a bonus.

title: nice place with nothing to do
review: this resort was very nice and cheap to stay,but there is nothing to do at all and that goes for the whole pointe estero area is pretty much lights out by 9:00 if you like to sleep on vacation this hotel and the area is for you if you like excitment good food alot of adventure and nicer water head to the east coast of florida it blows away the early to bed west coast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Paradise
review: We stayed at Point Estero in Oct 2010.  This ia great place to stay as it is on the quiet end of Fort Myers Beach. We were like little kids in a candy store when we saw the condo. We got a one bedroom condo and it was so huge. We had a massive bedroom with a wraparound balcony that looked out over the ocean. In the master bedroom was a jacuzzi with a shower built into the middle of the jacuzzi. The living room was really nice with a side balcony and the same wrap around balcony from the bedroom. I never seen a balcony so big before. We got some food at the supermarket down the street and had many meals on the balcony.  The place doesnt have many room so it is quiter except for when people sit on their balcony and talk and you can occasionally here somebody walking above you. The…

title: beautiful family place
review: we had such a great time here! the condos were like home away from home but on the beach. they had everything you could think of... pool, grills, jacuzzi in room screened in deck overlooking the ocean! perfect family vacation. plus the supermarket is down the road. and super clean!!

title: Wonderful place
review: We have stayed at the Resort before and will keep coming back time and time again.  The rooms are very clean and comfortable fully equipped with kitchenette and washer and dryer- a plus with kids.  The beach is just wonderful, very quiet and clean!  E excellent for a family vacation but also great for a romantic getaway!

title: Pointe Estero is the best!
review: Our Family has been staying at this property every summer for the past several years. Now it is just my husband and I.When it  comes time for me to start planning our "Florida" vacation I think we might try a new place. I search and search, look at reviews and pictures and read and read. I can never match the quality and value of this resort (except for Gullwing) which is their property located next door. If you want relaxing, quiet,cleanliness and value, this is it! There are no hidden fees! There is not a restaurant on premises, however there are very good places to eat within a few minute drive. The resort is well built so you do not hear the noise you do sometimes in other resorts. They offer maid service for a fee,but we actually like the fact that we do not have a maid…

title: We loved it!
review: The rooms were spacious and exactly what my family and I were looking for when we wanted to go on vacation.  We have gone to Fort Myers every year for about 6 years now and this was by far one of our favorite resorts to stay at.  Definitely would recommend friends to stay there.

title: Loved everything about the trip - condo, beach, location was perfect!
review: This was our first trip to Ft Myers Beach, although we had been to nearby Captiva Island a couple of years ago. Everything was great! The condo was clean and decorated nicely.  With two kids, it was great to have the second bathroom.  The master suite was excellent, with a comfy bed, its own TV, access to the balcony, and plenty of room.  It adjoined a good sized bathroom with dual sinks, and the super large jacuzzi tub was a favorite.   The kitchen was fully stocked with full sets of dishes and cookware, so we were able to cook many of our meals in the condo.  While we enjoyed several of the restaurants nearby, it was great to not have to eat out for every meal.  Plenty of seating in the dining area of the condo, too.  While no one wants to do laundry on vacation, the washer…

title: Great location!
review: We are a family of 4 (kids age 5 and 8) and thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend at the Pointe Estero.  The condo was clean and spacious.  The master bedroom view was amazing - who wouldn't love waking to the view of the beach and blue gulf every morning!  The kids loved that the second bedroom also had a view of the beach.  The balconies were large and screened (so you didn't have to share the balcony with the plentiful 'love bugs')  The location on the beach was perfect for us - quieter and away from the bustling nightlife of the north end of the island.  Lots of marine-life to see walking along the beach here.  A short drive to restaurants or the grocery store.  The beach rentals (chairs, umbrellas, etc) are expensive, but are independent and not part of the hotel.  But, since…

title: We loved it and will be back!!!
review: We stayed at Pointe Estero Beach resort Sept. 2010.  I made the reservation with Darla and she was very helpful and accomodating. We requested if there was a higher floor available at check in time could we have it. We checked in and we got the 8th floor. At the front desk i let them know that my sister was checking in a few days after and if possible could they put her on our floor. They did! I missed the mail p/u and wanted a post card to go and the girl at the front desk was going to lunch and was nice enough to put it in the mail for me also.  Very nice staff inside the hotel, making reservations and the guy doing the beach chairs on the beach.   The rooms was perfect and very clean and the view was spectacular. We only wanted a one bedroom when we booked but once we got…

title: Fantastic in every way!!!
review: From the start, we were impressed by the Pointe Estero Resort.  We had never been to the Fort Myers area, and so were not sure what to expect, even with the reviews on the site. Our plane arrived at 11:00PM, so the front desk was closed (10:00 PM). We knew this ahead of time and had arranged to have the key and a menu for some late-night food left in the lockbox, just as the Web site recommended.  To our great relief, all was just where the staff said it would be!  Our room on the fourth floor was excellent in every way. We traveled with our three kids ages 19, 21, and 23 years old. Everyone was impressed with the cleanliness, decor, and view.  Our ocean-front room was exactly what we expected!  There are three separate balconies with chairs and a table. There was a basket of…

title: Loved it again
review: Second visit to the Pointe Estero and we were not disappointed. This year we walked further along the beach appreciating how beautiful it is, turn left and walk for miles to see its changing beauty. We loved our Gulf view appartment with the wonderful views.It was so lovely and clean and when we had to look under the bed for a lost earring there was a card that advised 'Yes, we check here too' this proves the thorough cleaning the appartments get. We found the staff very attentive and friendly and they have the skill of being there when you need them. Publix is 2 miles down the road which makes self catering easy.  We will be visiting the Pointe Estero again with out a doubt, its the worth the journey from the UK.

title: Wonderful Resort
review: Dear Holidayfan58,  Thank you so much for your recent review of the resort.  We love to hear from our guests - and it's great to hear from repeat guests as well.  We hope we left a lasting impression and that you'll be back to see us again soon!  Sincerely, The Pointe Estero Beach Resort Management Team

title: remarkable
review: We were a party of five booked in a two bedroom beachfront suite.  Upon arrival at the resort, the first impression was wonderful.  The staff were warm and welcoming ... Ibrahim was a pleasure at check-in.  The unit was perfect for our party; beautiful location, large rooms, and a well-stocked kitchen and bathrooms.  One of the girls in our party encountered a dead car battery, so Enrique (?) was very helpful with arranging for a mechanic to jump-start the car until she could get to a store to buy a new battery.  The staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was pleasurable and memorable.  We liked having the gas BBQ grills and palapas (tiki huts) available for our use.  Great resort in a perfect location at an excellent value!  No resort fee and no parking fees were an…

title: Great condo with balcony and pretty view
review: but you must book an upper level floor to see the water.  If you are on lower levels your view will be obstructed by the landscaping.  If possible, try for the west side of the building so you can view the sunset from your awesome screened in balcony.      The accommodations were so nice - linens, beach towels, starter toiletries were great and hotel staff was very pleasant and extremely helpful - even jumping our battery when our car wouldn't start the day we were leaving for the airport.  Two of the maintenance staff  immediately came to our aid and we were on our way in about 5 minutes - amazing!        The only negatives to mention were the awful twin bed mattresses in the second bedroom.  They were the most uncomfortable beds we have ever slept in - much like spending the…

title: Clean, opulent, accomodations- a stones throw to the beach with a view to die for!
review: All you could ever want and more! From the moment we walked in we were greeted by friendly and professional staff who went out of their way to make us feel like we were the only people in the hotel. The room was extravagent- outfitted with tasteful furniture and an awesomely comfortable bed- not to mention an enormous tub with jets- Outside on the lanai a feast for the eyes- white sands as far as you can see!  While they didn't have an on property restaurant- Chloes restaurant at Pointe Estero's sister property was fantastic Dave D. made our meal special!

title: Exactly what you'd expect
review: We picked Pointe Estero for three reasons - 1. previous positive reviews; 2. location; and 3. you could book a condo daily rather than just Saturday - Saturday weekly, which allowed us to take advantage of Tuesday - Tuesday less expensive flights.  We were very pleased with everything about Pointe Estero.  We were placed on the first floor, and when we asked about possibly moving to a higher floor, they immediately re-assigned us with no problem.  Our condo was spacious, very clean, and stocked with the basics.  Additional dishwasher soap, laundry soap, etc. are available at the front desk for $1 each.  Access to the beautiful beach is so simple, with cabanas or umbrellas available for multi-day rental.  Outrigger Tiki Bar a few buildings down the beach quenches any afternoon…

title: Definitely Return
review: The Pointe Estero was recommended to us by friends...and it didn't disappoint.  The one-bedroom gulfview apartment was spacious, clean and had every amenity needed.  The layout was especially nice, affording views of the Gulf of Mexico from the living room and master bedroom's wrap around screened in balcony.  The pool was very nice, plenty of chairs for everyone -- in shade or sun.   Staff at the front desk was always ready to help and offer recommendations for dinner.  We would definitely return

title: Excellent
review: Great place to stay!  Great staff!  Huge rooms-like having your own apartment.  Huge beach.  Close to great eating places or grab some food and prepare it in your room.  Will be staying at again.  Thanks for everything!

title: Great Family Vacation
review: I chose this resort from using Trip Advisor.  I have not been let down yet.  The accomadations we're great.  Very clean place, traveled with 4 teenage girls.  We we're far enough away from the loud spring break games, but close enough that my girls participated and did feel left out of a traditional "Spring Break". Our condo was everything that I had anticipated and the girls were happy with accomadations also.  We had six in our condo and had plenty of space that we we're not on top of each other.

title: Best Place on the Beach!!
review: We have stayed at Pointe Estero several times and we love it!  We like that it has a full size kitchen so we save money by eating in.  The rooms have always been clean - my most important requirement - and they are spacious, have amazing views, and they feel like a home away from home.  We have stayed at a couple of other places which have cost much more, but we like Pointe Estero the best.  We tell all our friends about it!

title: Wonderful Resort!
review: Clean, comfortable suites with gorgeous views of the beach and sunsets.  Friendly and efficient staff.  Complete kitchen in each unit and TV's in living room and bedrooms.  Plenty of towels for your use...washer & dryer in every unit.  They even supply you with a start up package for your wash, dishwasher, and coffee maker.  Paper towels, toilet paper, trash bags and tissues are supplied for free!  Can't wait to book next year!!!

title: Absolultely love this place!
review: This has been our 3rd trip to Pointe Estero Beach Resort.  The people who work there have always been very helpful and friendly.  Our condo is always spotless and fresh. Full size fridge, stove, with cooking utensils, dishwasher, washer and dryer,  everything you need to call the place your home.  The pool and hot tub are always clean.  Plenty of towels for outside use that are in your room, 3 outside grills that were very clean, even though we didn't use them I checked them out.  Having the neatly groomed white sand beach outside your door is priceless!  Great vacation from this year's New England winter.  The resort is rated 3 stars sometimes 3.5, don't understand why it's not 4 stars. Want to take friends with us next year.

title: tropical  paradise  grounds, home like condo
review: We have been vacationing here for the last 8 years. The setting & grounds are a, tropical  oasis, the beach is superb for walking, sunbathing, shelling. The condos are clean and comfortable. The bathrooms could use a little updating but are  clean. The staff is friendly and  attentive. I would not vacation  anywhere  else but  here!!!

title: Highly recommend for romantic/peaceful trip
review: This resort is wonderful for a vacation condo.  We enjoyed the property very much.  Very clean and extremely well built, so it is very quiet.  Staff was very prompt to fix any problems and helpful.  The downfall, is the beach is extremely wide, and it's a long walk to the water.

title: Great stay-we will return
review: Our family of 6 stayed there the week prior to Christmas.  we were in unit 303 and it was spotless.  The beds were very comfortable and even the hideabed was not too bad.   The unit was very clean.  We would have liked to use the wrap around patio more but it just was not warm enough and was in the shade at all times. Pool was very clean and warm as was the hot tub. We took advantage of the volleyball and tennis court as well as the fitmess center, which was minimal. Every desk staff we encountered was very helpful and friendly. The  unit had internet for free.  We had a great stay and will stay there again next time the family is in Ft Myers beach.

title: All that I'd hoped for!
review: The resort was all that I had hoped for. Often I am disappointed when arriving at a destination, but not this time. The TripAdvisor reviews were helpful in making my decision to stay at this resort. The gentleman and young lady that were at the front desk were not only friendly and attentive but also gave great recommendations when asked about dining. The room was clean without having that bleach smell that so many places have when trying to act clean. Our room was on the side but because of how each is set up, we had a perfect view of the beach and a beautiful sunset. The rates were affordable for this off time of year, I do hope they are reasonable if next time we come in a differant season.The location is near golf and water activities, as well as dining. Although our stay…

title: loved it,again.
review: I have been to fort myers beach numerous times,and my wife and i love pointe estero,the staff are friendly at checkin,but not obtrusive,they let you get on with your vacation,any problems are dealt with.The views front and rear are wonderful,the furnshings  are nice,and the bathrooms are spotless,you will go along way to find a better resort at a competitive price,see you all next year.

title: Estero Pointe Resort is wonderful!
review: We returned from a first time trip to Fort Myers and stayed at Estero Pointe. This resort is one of the best places we have stayed. The grounds are immaculate. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo.They rooms are spacious and have everything you would need.  There were 17 of us that went on this trip and all of us said we would return!

title: Awesome!!
review: I would recommend this resort to everyone! Abraham,made our stay perfect. He is the most gracious, and thoughtful person, always smiling and ready to help in any way. The room was great, very clean and roomy. The beach & pool were just a few steps away, and restaurants were within walking distance.

title: Simply PERFECT!
review: As soon as we walked in the door, we were greeted by Aberham's smiling face, he was super in every way. We had an amazing room, comfortable and clean. The views were beautiful. The pool and beach were clean and quiet. All suggestions from the office about directions and places to eat and see were top notch. Dinner at Anthonys was warm and inviting too! We would LOVE to come back soon!

title: Great price for a very comfortable week-long stay
review: We spent a week here in August of 2009, and had a great time enjoying our stay. We did get a rental car - I'm not sure we would have been able to get by without one. The beaches were great, and the room was much larger than I'm used to while on vacation. Kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed and the balcony view was pleasant. No complaints, would come back if I made it to Fort Myers again.

title: Great location on the beach
review: Spent four days at Pointe Estero in room 504.  Really liked the set up of the room.  The balcony was huge.  Easy walk to the beach.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Would definitely go back again.

title: Awesome place to stay for family with young children !
review: We stayed here during the 1st week in May - perfect time...no crowds and great weather.  The Pointe Estero was wonderful.  Our room was 1003 on the north side and we had a great view of the beach/sunset!  Plenty of space for our family (children are 3 and 4 years old). Nice to have laundry and a kitchen available.  Our room had a king bed in one bedroom, and a pull out sofa in the living area for the kids.  Also had 2 full baths - large tub in the master which also had a shower (kind of unusual).  Everything was very clean with the exception of some minor mold in bath (there is humidity in Florida afterall!). There was another room with 2 twin beds, but it was locked an unaccessable to us.  The screened porch was great.  The front desk had puzzles and books you could borrow as…

title: Hoping to come back again!!!
review: Renting a car is a necessity here, being so far down on the beach. But if you love peace and quiet, this is the place!! Only problem was the noise from the condo next door. They were renovating and the noise started very early in the morning, so we had to keep the doors closed all the time.Sitting on the decks was out too because of the noise level, oh well, it wasn't their fault!!Staff was top notch all the way!!! Plenty to do here, lots of beauty and nature to soak in!!

title: Great place away from the hubbub
review: We really enjoyed our stay at Pointe Estero.  A few things to consider however.    First and foremost, you will be taking the trolley or renting a car to get to Times Square or the touristy part of the Ft Myers beach.  We had a car, and that was fine with us, but be aware of it if you like to be in walking distance of things.  Secondly, I read a few reviews that said you can walk to the Publix.  That is certainly true, but I wouldn't want to make that walk with more than a bag or two to carry.  Since you have a full kitchen, it makes sense to stock up some and save yourself some dough on eating out.  We did this, but were glad we had a car.  To be fair, you can take the trolley to Publix as well, but I would not enjoy sitting out in the heat holding onto a bunch of bags while I…

title: Loved it!
review: We stayed at the Pointe Estero Beach Resort. Beautiful view, clean rooms, friendly staff, great pool and whirlpool, white sand beach,  We had a great time.

title: Excellent place for all ages.
review: Stayed at the Pointe Estero Resort in the penthouse - 8 family members from age 4 to 64.  Beautiful view, clean rooms, friendly staff, great pool and whirlpool, white sand beach.  Only bad thing about our stay was the cold weather and 1 day it rained which had nothing to do with the resort.  Would like to go back again.

title: This place is fantastic!
review: We were looking for somewhere to relax and unwind after a busy summer/fall sports schedule. We chose Pointe Estero over our kid's fall break from school and it was FANTASTIC! The rooms are extremely clean and very large...the pool is quite large with plenty of seating and spread out so you're not 'on top' of other guests. The hotel is directly on the beach, but quite a way back from the water - a bit of a walk, but that was fine too. The staff was very friendly. They had nice gas grills (clean) and a grocery store very close. The only 'dislike' was that coffee wasn't served in the lobby until late morning...that's it! This was one of the most memorable vacations our family has taken and I would go back to Point Estero in a heartbeat!

title: Great place, perfect for families
review: We stayed at Pointe Estero from March 6 to March 11.  We had a 2 bedroom beachfront condo.  It had a king bedroom and a second bedroom with two twins.  The condo was perfect as it was roomy with a full kitchen, two baths, two balcony's with oceanviews and a washer and dryer.  The complex has a huge beach and a wonderful pool area that is great for kids.  We used the outdoor bbq grills a couple times for lunch.  I would highly recommend this resort.  It is very close to a grocery store and numerous restaurants.  In addition, a short drive to Bonita Springs (10 mins) provides lots of shopping and restaurant chains.  We have a 2 year old son who enjoyed the condo and had lots of room to run around and act his age.  The front office staff was very friendly and the maintenance crews…

title: Fabulous!!
review: We travelled with our 4 boys here in July/August 2008 and I would go back TODAY!! The place is fantastic!! Our "suite" had 3 bedrooms, full kitchen, living room, AND a washer/dryer (which is a life-saver when travelling with kids)!! It was much nicer than some of the apartments I've lived in!! It was spacious enough that we weren't all on top of one another all the time, yet not overwhelmingly large either. There is a Publix down the road so we stocked up on groceries and saved on the cost of eating out for every meal. My husband and I had stayed in Ft Myers Beach a few times before and loved it, so we were anxious to give our kids a trip we knew they'd enjoy, and they DID!! There are several things to see nearby and we took advantage of that! They're begging to go back! The…

title: Lovely, relaxed place to stay with friends
review: I stayed here for a "girls weekend".  The room was very spacious with plenty of room for the 6 of us.  Loved the large kitchen and beautiful balcony views of the Gulf.  Balcony is large enough to eat breakfast out there.  Screened in balcony makes it hard to take pictures but appreciated it keeping the bugs out.  One complaint is that the sofa bed is not the most comfortable thing, so truly sleeping 6 people was slightly less than ideal.  Still, a great place to spend a relaxing beach vacation.  Quieter location further away from the times square area.  Pool was warm and the hot tub very relaxing.  We loved it!

title: LOVED IT !
review: LOVED IT ! Great place - Mstr suite - balcony- view in partial view rm is great - grilling area - beach !!! Live an hour away and is a great get away !!!

title: Absolutely the best.
review: Everything I read about and was told by the staff was absolutely true.  Our room was as clean as could be, was exactly like the pictures on the website and had everything we needed for our stay.  The staff was friendly and very informative.  At one point when we asked about a particular restaurant, the front desk employee not only recommended it, but gave us a coupon.  When we asked about what we needed to do before checking out - again another front desk employee told us, ' you are on vacation, we will take care of the room after you are gone.'   The pool area was kept very clean and was beautiful, the grounds were spotless and of course the beach was perfect.  Even the fellow renting beach chairs and umbrellas (who I'm sure didn't work for the hotel) was friendly and fun.

title: Great room and pool
review: The room was incredible with walkout balconies for both main bedroom and guestroom. You could see the beach and the pool of the hotel next to us. The screened in porches took away from a perfect view but you could still see well enough. The walk from the hotel to the ocean takes about 3 minutes which made it a little more challenging to see the 'goings on' at the beach. Bring binoculars to watch the dolphins go by twice a day.   Once you are at the beach, the dolphins are maybe 100 feet from shore. My son and I had a dolphin come within in 7 feet of us while we were wading. The water was very clear which helped us to find buried shells including conch shells. There were thousands of sand dollars too. So much wildiife where we stayed, osprey, pelicans diving for fish, seagulls…

title: This place is AWESOME!
review: My wife have traveled a lot in our years together, and Pointe Estero exceeded our expections for a condo in every way.  I did extensive online research before finding this place, and the unit we stayed in (#903-Gulf View) was absolutely spectacular.  Not only was the interior outfitted beyond the normal requirements, but the views of BOTH the bay area and gulf were awesome.  The views were actually BETTER with a gulf view room than a gulf front room in our opinions, because one could see a lot more in both directions.  The grounds were also immaculate in every way, and had a certain "South Seas" feel with the palm trees, walkways, and rock waterfall.  Staff was very friendly and attentive also.  Too much so, in our case, because we were acting like teenagers and hanging out in…

title: Fantastic stay. Great resort with great staff.
review: Traveled with another couple to Fort Myers Beach and stayed at Pointe Estero. We were very pleased with our choice.  The resort is very well maintained. The staff here also really seems to care about the guests and was happy and helpful.  From the moment we checked in, and any time we stopped at the front desk the staff made you feel welcome.   The two bedroom-2 bath condo we had was perfect. Very clean and well maintained and the kitchen had everything you could need. All furnishings were comfortable and in very good shape.  The master bath was wonderful with a huge Jacuzzi tub. Both baths were spotless and in great shape. The second bath also contained a washer\dryer combo which came in handy. The master bedroom was very large with a king bed and plenty of closet space. I…

title: Great Stay
review: Large condo, enjoyed the outdoor grills. Nice beach and pool.

title: Beautiful comfortable resort
review: From the moment we walked into our condo we were pleased.  The view was spectacular and the furnishing were tropical and comfortable.  Enjoyed the beach, Gulf, and even the tremendous rainstorm that lasted  1/2 hour.  The pool, spa and bbq were great.  The staff was friendly and anxious to help us with anything we needed.  We'll be going back in November.

title: Nice place bad location
review: We stayed there from Wed-Sun check was easy and fast the front desk people were very wonderful with everything.......  The room was big and nice but for the 2nd bedroom it only had twin beds for the kids but they had a wonderful view we did the beach front on the 7th floor it was a awesome view from every room!  Very quiet and spacious.  The only downfall was the LONG walk to the beach and the beach is very shelly.  The pool was dirty but other than that they had bbq grills that you could use which was nice cause it was kind of far away from everything.  It takes about 15 min to get to time square by car or by trolley which the trolley was awesome if it only came more then once a hour and the last pick up was 8:30 from time square other wise a taxi ride is about $15 one way.  I…

title: A great family vacation resort
review: Great service, friendly and helpful staff. Room was excellent! Wrap around patio balcony had views of the beach and pool area. Jacuzzi bath in master bathroom. Great furnished kitchen with modern appliances. Nice pool area with well manicure grounds. Barbecues located near the pool. Walk out the back and the beach is right there. Beach chairs/umbrellas available for $20. Great shelling along the beach with parasailing/wave runner rentals next door. Only thing lacking was a restaurant on site but there is one next door. Also, less then a 1/2 mile is a strip mall with restaurants/gift shops. My recommendation is the Bayside Bistro which is located a little north of the resort. A Publix is also located there. Definitely rent a car since the trolley runs every hour.

title: OK Resort, Poor Area
review: I have just returned from a 3 week stay in a 2 bed beachfront condo.  Whilst the condo was spacious and comfortable, the decor, furnishings and equipments were rather aged and tired.   Situated on the "widest stretch of Fort Myers Beach" it is certainly in the best part of town however the wide stretch of beach does mean you are subjected to a good 5 - 10 min walk across the sands to reach the water's edge and following any heavy rain, the majority of this is waterlogged.   There is a pool area which is quite small and fairly basic.  The area itself was disappointing with few decent shops and NO decent places to eat other than the Sandbar and Grill.   We did try a few, specifically the Gulfshore Grill and Bayfront Bistro, both of which were abysmal with the rudest and most…

title: Pointe Estero is a Hidden Gem
review: My wife and I have stayed here on two seperate occasions and depending on the time of year you stay it can be a really great value.  It is a Condo, so you don't have all the amenities of a hotel, such as maid service, etc. But I don't care anything about that anyway. The size of the rooms make up for the lacking amenities you may receive at a hotel.   The pool area is nicely landscaping and it is a decent size, however, I am not sure who made the architectual decision to place the pool in the FRONT of the resort instead of right on the beach on the backside of the resort. That to me is a downside, I always enjoy relaxing at the pool but still being able to look out over the ocean.  As for the beach, while it wasn't a problem for me, I heard others complaining on how long of a…

title: GREAT RESORT!
review: We are just home from a great but short vacation to Fort Myers, FL.  We chose the Pointe Estero Resort in Fort Myers Beach based on price.  The website was appealing but in the past have gotten burnt by depending on advertisement alone.  I came to Trip Advisor to read the review.  This is what I, personally, found to be the truth.  The resort is lovely.  It is well cared for and well maintained.  The pool area is very nice.  The landscaping is, again, well maintained.  There were seasonal bugs everywhere - no see'ms or something.  No big deal.  The beach area is huge.  Our condo unit was beachfront, an extra cost but well worth it for us.  We had two screened in balconies that were so nice, day and night.  We used our kitchen for the fridge alone!  Although we did cook outside…

title: Spotless, great beach
review: Perfect spot for a vacation with young families.  My daughter slept great in the crib, much better than a pack and play.  The resort also provided a high chair which was a lifesaver.  I also liked how the patio was screened in.  We left the doors to the room open most of the time.  There was nothing to complain about as far as the resort goes.  Fort Myers beach sees a lot of traffic and sometimes car barely moved at all.  This ate away a lot of hours on our vacation.  If you plan to stay this far south on the island, plan on at least a half an hour to get off the island and into Fort Myers or to the interstate.  Take advantage of the trolley just outside the resort too. One other thing I  noticed is that things really seem to wrap up at 10:00.  We had a hard time finding a bar…

title: Awesome
review: Arrived at Pointe Estero and was very impressed the minute we walked in.  Abraham was very pleasant, kind  and helpful at the front desk.  He also gave us information  about local restaurants to dine that were excellent choices.  Our room was 10th floor, beachfront and WOW what a view.  The room was beautifully decorated and very clean and comfortable.  The beach was wide and white sand.  Will absolutely go back again.  Can't say enough about this wonderful condo.  Very enjoyable stay.  Hated to leave.

title: Pointe Estero wins by a mile!
review: Perfectly situated between the touristy scene in 'downtown' Fort Myers Beach and the Bonita Springs area, Poine Estero proved to be worth the heaping praise I'll write!  Mostly agree with many of the review posted here, and the area's I take issue with are actually quite small. The 'fully' equipped kitchens will suit all but the Epicurean as the tools provided are a bit lacking in quality. (go buy your own chef, santoku, and other knives and cutting board at the very convenient Publix food market just down the stretch on Estero Blvd.) Ship them back to yourself when done; if you plan to use the otherwise great kitchen. I made use of the gas grills quite often and was very pleased to see how clean they're kept.  The accommodations also were great and I did not need to use the…

title: great resort fantastic location
review: We spent about 10 days at Pointe Estero Resort with my wife and dauthers aged 14 and 11. This place is very well located in the quiet area of Fort Myers Beach, where the beach is wide and beautiful. We had beach front suite, on the 8th floor, so we could enjoy the beautiful landscape every day. Clean, quiet, large rooms; excellent front desk service. Small but great heated swimming pool and hot spa. Direct access to the beach, ideal for sun bath and running. what else do you need to enjoy great family holidays?! We can't wait returning to this premium resort next year.

title: Great hotel. Good place.
review: BOOKING: Though we looked at a variety of traveler websites, the best price remained that which the hotel itself offered when we called. They also offered to match any price we would find elsewhere. Shop around, then ask for a price match with the hotel. It's worth it.  RATE: We were off season, so we had good rates. Considering the room size, and the hotel's location, it is a very good value room.  HOTEL LOCATION: On the far side of Estero Island, the hotel gives onto a very large Fort Myers Beach. Located 6.5 km (4 miles) from Times Square, the beach's "downtown" where you find a few more restaurants, music in the evening, and the local youth, you will likely not have to deal with bothersome guests or noisy nights. However, you will be located about 2.5km (1.6 miles) from the…

title: Loved it  Want to go back now
review: this is a wonderful place.  My boys are now teenagers and a small hotel room was not going to cut it.  Walking into our condo on the 15th floor was like walking into a new home. having all the amenities of a home made our vacation that much better. my husband and I could separate ourselves in our big master bedroom and not worry about what the boys were doing.  the beach is lovely and I didn't mind paying for the cabanas the days we were there.  The birds on this end of the island are amazing. The ospreys were flying over us everyday and the dolphins were jumping in the water just beyond the bouy markers.  the only small negatives were the second bathroom had a plumbing issue, the garbage disposal leaked, and when the afternoon storms came in it created a howling noise because…

title: Spotless, Friendly, Relaxed and Wonderful
review: My family ( son 12 and wife) and I spent June 21-28 at this resort. Gorgeous, clean, opulent, spacious 2 bedrooms, living room, big jacuzzi, gorgeous fully equipped kitchen . . .  The staff are incredibly helpful.  The beach is pure white sand and teh refuge/ wetland adjacent kept the wildlife sites great . . tons of conch, all sizes fish, crabs, rays, a dolphin, schools of med. fish, more shells than you know what to do with.  Took WestJet down, rented from Thrifty- both efficient.  Breakfast at Waffle House up the road (Estero blvd) or s. until it hits Tamiami at teh Perkins (great dinner $) too . .   Lunch was a sandwhich from subway or food we make from teh Publix grocer.  A layback destination- water, sun and sand- great pool too. We'll be back next year for sure- no…

title: A wonderful treat!
review: We loved our stay at Pointe Estero. We were on the 10th floor, with a wonderful view of the Gulf and the bay.   The place was immaculate, the kitchen was well equipped, the grills outside by the pool were great, the pool was nice, the beach was beautiful (very fine sand),.. We enjoyed the jacuzzi in the master bedroom and the fact that the screened balcony was accessible from the living room and the bedroom.  We highly recommend this place if you're looking for a quiet, relaxing stay. There are not a lot of restaurants or shops nearby...you have to travel up or down the key and then head inland...but there's a good supermarket only a mile away.

title: Pointe Estero, Beautiful place to stay in Fort Myers Beach
review: Pointe Estero is absolutely beautiful!!  We were there April 19th thru the 24th.We stayed in a one bedroom facing the gulf. Beautifully decorated and beautiful sunsets. Didn't even need air conditioning to sleep at night with the doors opened you wake up with the sound of the water.  Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definetely stay at Pointe Estero AGAIN.

title: Fantastic Condo
review: Well positioned right on the beach at the quieter end where the beach gets very wide. The 2 bedroomed beachfront condo we had was on the 15th floor and was really great with comfortable and stylish furniture.  Master bedroom was good size with fantastic large jacuzzi bath in the bathroom and 2nd bedroom was also good with direct access to the second bathroom. Balconies had access from all the rooms with amazing outlook over the beach especially good for the sunsets. Kitchen was well equipped with all necessary electrical appliances except there was no kettle (essential for the British!) Front desk staff were very helpful and gave good information on restaurants, golf courses, shopping and much more. Free internet access at all times reception is open and free coffee until 11 a.m…

title: Pointe Estero, a great place for a vacation!
review: My husband and I just returned from a week at Pointe Estero Resort on Ft. Myers Beach. We had a great time.  The suites are huge (almost too big for 2 people).  The Gulf views and sunsets are spectacular.  We were looking for a 'quiet' vacation and received just that.  I'm a very light sleeper and don't sleep well in a hotel.  Not so at Pointe Estero.  The rooms are so quiet you never hear doors slamming, water running or even the sound of the waves unless the sliding doors are open.  It was very relaxing and enjoyable.  We spent a lot of time by the heated pool and always found lounges available.  We've stayed at other Sunstream Resorts in Florida and have never been disappointed.  I would highly recommend it for anyone wanting a quiet vacation resort.

title: Nice beach, nice staff, large and clean units
review: We had 2 two-bedroom condos here January 2-6, 2008. Each floor has 4 units (2 beach front and 2 gulf view). We stayed in the Gulf View units (rooms 601 and 603) which had nice views of the beach and water. The unit on the south side of the building seemed to get more sun on the balcony than the one on the north side of the building. Both units were very quiet and private feeling even though there were lots of windows in the unit.  The rooms themselves were large and clean though they aren't new and there are some small things that are showing some wear such as the paint on the kitchen faucet and the finish on the bathtub faucet. We stayed at the Bela Sera in Naples last year and that was newer and more upscale though it wasn't on the beach. The pool area was clean and the pool…

title: Excellent value
review: I like to hear the sound of the ocean at night and that was one of the reasons why I booked this hotel. Well, it is directly at the beach, but it is a quite large beach. So large that you dont hear the soft waves from the Gulf of Mexico. To note that there is nothing around the hotel, so you need a car to go shopping or to the restaurants (except for the Holiday Inn restaurant in walking disance which we liked). Apart from that, it is absoilutely perfect: very well equipped suites, very well maintained, outmostly friendly and competent staff and the price is ok (USD 205 fror Oceanfront Suite).

title: Agree with James Flynn
review: I brought my Mom to see her sister....what a wonderful place...can't wait to go back.  I did alot of research before I chose this place.

title: Go there!!
review: This was the 4th time we had travelled all the way from Ireland just to stay in this super accomodation. The view from the room is just amazing and when we stayed on July 4th, the beach was littered with people celebrating the date and having their own private fBBQ and fireworks display. From our balcony we were able to enjoy them all- it was truly a most hospitable and family atmosphere. The accomodation was very clean on arrival and did not take much upkeep during our 12 night stay. Am already planning to take the 10 hour flight again next year, all being well. Go there!!

title: Wonderful and relaxing with kids
review: Just returned from Pointe Estero on Ft. Myers beach 11/3/07 - 11/10/07. We are in late 30's with a 4 and 7 yr old. This was our first time to the florida gulf coast. Here are the highlights: 1. oceanfront condo, 4th floor, fantastic, very spacious, clean, full kitchen, huge in suite jacquizzi, absolutely the best private balcony ( 2 in ocean front units). 2. pool - very large and heated, open till 10 pm.  Hot tub awesome.  Me and the kids spent most of the day each day poolside and even some nights as well. The pool deck was very ample and as it was off season, chairs were readily available and we practically had the pool to ourselves. 3. kids program - a joke, don't bother, again this was off season, so I don't know if that matters. 4. beach - the biggest beach I have ever seen…

title: Back to my favorite place (again)
review: Just came back from Pointe Estero and, as usual, loved every minute of it! From the room, which is probably the nicest (and cleanest) you'll ever find in Fort Myers Beach, to the beach which is fabulous and always quiet. I also love going 'off season' when there is no traffic and no crowds - let's me feel like it's my own paradise. Can't wait to go back again

title: A slice of heaven
review: My sister and I stayed at Pointe Estero Beach Resort Sept. 9 til 15th. We were amazed with our two bedroom condo, it was huge and the views from the balconies were breathtaking. It was more than we could have expected for the price. We were surprised that there was a washer and dryer and dishwasher, which had single soap packets to use during our stay. The master suite was completely equipt with a huge Jacuzzi tub and balcony that wrapped all around the room showing off the white, sandy beach view and sunset every evening. We spend each day either at the pool, which was not crowded at all, very warm, and clean, or beach! There is also a small fitness center with a TV on the 1st floor and ice machine in the lobby, which came in handy for our cooler for the beach. We ventured to…

title: Great romantic escape!
review: My husband and I  stayed over the weekend at the point Estero Resort ,  we had a wonderful time. The apartment was impecable.We loved the large jacuzzi tub overlooking the pool area. Everything was spotless. The stay was well  worth the small price we paid,as compared to stays at hotels were you only get a rrom. We will definetly  come back not ony as a couple , but  with our family for a vacation very soon.

title: Wonderful honeymoon!
review: We stayed at Pointe Estero while on our honeymoon in August of 2007.  We got a great rate by booking on the Sunstrem website.  We requested a higher floor and were given a 10th floor oceanfront unit.  The unit was immaculate when we arrived.  I tend to be picky about cleanliness and Pointe Estero met my requirements.  The bathtub was bigger than any I have ever seen.  The furnishings were comfortable and the kitchen was equipped with everything we could possibly need.  Screened in balconies overlooking the beach topped it all off.  The pool area was also beautiful.  The maintenance workers tended to everything early in the mornings and we bumped into them on our way to sunrise walks.  Everyone at Pointe Estero was extremely friendly from the front desk staff to the maintenance…

title: A Romantic Celebration!
review: A beautiful and romantic atmosphere!  The view of the Ocean was breath taking as well as the sunset! Our stay was enjoyable, the rooms impeccably clean and spacious and the Master bath....I could swim across the tub it was so huge (slightly exaggerated )  I would love to stay at this Hotel whenever possible, hopefully,  it will be frequent! :-)   I bid you peace, enjoy your stay!

title: One of the Best!
review: We stayed at Pointe Estero from June 16-21.  I would have a difficult time finding anything to criticize either about the accomodations or the staff.  The check-in went smoothly even though we arrived a couple hours early.  Our unit, on the 10th floor was ready and could not have been better.  The pool area and beach were great--clean and uncrowded.  One of the two elevators was down on Sunday, so that caused some delays, but nothing major.  They few times we needed to deal with the staff, front desk or otherwise, was very pleasant and all of our questions or needed were handled well.  This is a great place in a great location and we would recommend it to one and all.

title: Lovely
review: Let me start by saying THANK YOU to all the staff. Their customer service excelled from front desk to housekeeping. Everyone said hello, how are you and how can I help you. We totally enjoyed our stay and the accommodation were very comfortable. We slept like babies.  I had one small problem that needs mention. We were placed on the 1st floor which is one flight up. Our main patio was over the A/C compressors and the main dryer unit for the resort. It was a hot week so sitting out to enjoy an ocean breeze was not going to happen. On one occassion my parents (in their 80's) and my aunt (79) came over for lunch. I made a call to the front desk and they turned off the dryer unit so we could enjoy our lunch. The best part of being on the 1st floor, we never had to wait for the…

title: Nice, But could be better!
review: This is our second visit to Pointe Estero, and it is lovely.  However, a few things that could make it better.  First, I booked our reservation in Feb for a May trip and had requested a higher floor, because last year when we were here they were doing maintenance work on the beach side and were awoken very early by the sound of drilling and hamming.  Also, we don't have children and don't like to listen to kids on the way to the beach in the morning over coffee and the paper.  I called many times before my visit to verify that my request was still in place and felt that as return guests, they should accommodate our request.  Upon our arrival we were placed on the 4th floor and this infuriated me.  I was told there was nothing available, (of course) and it was this or nothing. …

title: Pointe Estero but 2 comments
review: Pointe Estero nice but, go buy a beach chair the first day you are there for $10.00 and give it away when you leave.  Beats $20.00 / day for cabana.  To lie on a towel will get uncomfortable.  Next, agree with other reviewer. Staff will not budge on late checkout - there is no way they are all full every night! They prepare for the request and rather then grant it on occassion, they flat out refuse.

title: We'll return next year!
review: Just returned last night from a six night's stay at Pointe Estero Resort.  My family loved it!  Nice pool and beautiful white sand beach.  I highly recommend the 2 bedroom suite, plenty of room for a family of four to spread out and enjoy some privacy.  Kitchen was fully equipped and the local Publix Grocery store is just down the street.  Hotel has a few grocery carts available to transport your supplies up to your suite. Next trip I'll plan on using the outdoor grills that are available near the pool.    Staff was friendly and helpful providing tourist information.  We rented a cabana for two days, saw 3 dolphins playing near shore and enjoyed the parasailing near the hotel.  The resort is centrally located, allowing us to take a day trips to Sanibel/Captiva Islands and…

title: Spring break family heaven
review: We stayed at Pointe Estero for spring break last week & couldn't have asked for nicer vacation!  We've stayed before on the north end of Fort Myers Beach & decided to stay on the "quieter end" this time for a change.
