Pointe Estero offered a fabulous view, gorgeous pool/whirlpool, on sight tennis, & a nice family vacation.  Traveling with a 12 & 15 year old we found the tennis, pool/beach, walking to restaurants & activities great.  Some tips- during spring break times, if you want to go to the north end of the island, it is possible, but leaving earlier to avoid the traffic crawl is worth it  (by 5p.m. or so).  You can drive or take the shuttle.  With a teen you probably need to check out the t-shirt shops & bustle of the northern part of the island at least once.  My husband &…

title: BEST VIEW, BEST BEACH
review: The worst part of our stay was leaving!  The units are all 2 bedroom, only 4 on a floor, all have good views.  The apartments were well outfitted, and furnished.  Located at the quiet less congested end of the beach, only a couple of restaurants and shops to walk to.  Staff was friendly and helpful and everything was in good condition.

title: Beach + Screened Porch + Amazing Room!
review: This place was incredible! Kitchen was very nice as well as the oversized bathroom and bedroom (s)... however, you can't put bubbles in the bathtub (don't know why)??? The rooms were great and you really cannot beat the price for an amazing Florida vacation. It's right on the strip of Ft. Myers beach!    I recommend getting a car while you are staying, Naples and Sanibel Island are within a half an hour drive of the resort.    This isn't a full on luxury place to go, but if you are looking for a great place to Chill, I recommed it!

title: Great condo but Sunstream does not grant late checkouts
review: Beautiful resort and nicely re-done.  Great balconies, a very nice condo.  Out of the main area of congestion on Ft. Myers Beach with a lovely deep beach.    My only complaint about Pointe Estero and Gullwing after multiple stays is they don't ever seem to grant late checkouts.  Check out is 10am, and mid-January on a Tuesday I somehow doubt they are full.  But every time I've stayed at a Sunstream resort and asked for a late checkout, even one hour, they have not agreed.  When I'm on vacation I plan to make the most of my days there; this would be reason for me to consider staying somewhere else.  If that's not important to you, this is a great place to stay.

title: The Resort suited our needs great!
review: We rented a 2 bed/2 bath suite. It was huge! The master bath is amazing. We had a partial ocean view, which was nice. The furnished patio is huge as well. The entire suite was very new looking and clean. The kitchen is a nice size with all the cooking and eating utensils you could possibly need. There is a nice pool and pretty waterfall on the grounds. The beach is nice and big.  The downfall of this resort is the proximity to restraunts. There is really nothing within close walking distance.

title: Return Guest; Love Pointe Estero - Glad they are Remodeling
review: NOTE:  Pointe Estero is closing from June-November 2006 for renovations.  This is my third year staying at the Pointe Estero.  First two we booked beachfronts.  This year, I called Sunstream directly in January to book my last-week-of-April vacation.  I wanted to book on the phone to be sure I received the return guest rate.  I called the Friday before my Sunday arrival to see what floor they had put us on as this was the first year I had not requested "above Floor 8."  They told me I was on Floor 15.  When we arrived two days later, we were told we were now on Floor 3.  When we got out of the elevator, our reservation was incorrectly booked as a Gulfview instead of a Beachfront.  I hadn't noticed this error on my February confirmation letter.  I was disappointed but the room…

title: Pointe Estero Exceeded Our Expectations
review: After finding out that our first two choices did not have rooms available for the dates we were going to be on Ft. Myers Beach, we were able to book our third choice, the Pointe Estero.  Boy were we really glad we ended up with our third choice!    We orignally wanted to stay at the Edison Beach House because it got great reviews and was close to the water and close to shopping and dining.  But when they didn't have availability we  decided on the Gull Wing because it looked really nice and also got good reviews.  They didn't have any beachfront rooms available for our dates so we finally called the Pointe Estero which is right next door to the Gull Wing.  We were able to book a beachfront one-bedroom suite for all three nights, and I requested a room on the 10th floor or higher…

title: Loved Pointe Estero, perfect Fort Myers Beach resort!
review: My family travels each year in May, and this year we went to Fort Myers Beach. We stayed at Pointe Estero for 9 nights, and it was outstanding. Absolutely wonderful. We had a 2-bedroom oceanfront suite, and every evening we watched the sunset over the ocean while eating dinner on our screened-in balcony. The resort is nicely situated, centrally located for a SW FLorida vacation... we went south to the Everglades, north to Sanibel, Captiva and Cayo Costa islands. May is the perfect time to go to SW FLorida... the beaches were quiet, it felt like we had our own private beach and resort. The facilities were clean, nicely appointed. If I had to find a fault, it would be that daily housekeeping isn't provided, which means you have to do more of your own cleaning, etc. Not a big deal.…

title: perfect vacation for the whole family
review: Perfect vacation for the whole family.  The rooms were very clean, plenty of towels, lots of space for our family of 4.  The beach was beautiful (although a long walk down the sand to the water), staff was very friendly and pool area was great and never to crowded.  My family will be back again.

title: Outstanding!
review: I just Came Back From Pointe Estero What A Beautifull Resort Right on the Beach Perfect location Nice Clean Pool And Jacuzzi.  Staff was Extremly Nice check out time was 10 AM  we had a Late Flight so the Staff Gave us Beach towels and let us Use the Pool VERY NICE  of them We had A Two Bedroom Unit on the 14th Floor it was Extremly Clean Great View of the Ocean I Highly Reccomend Pointe Estero !

title: Loved this resort!
review: My husband, son and I just returned from a 6 night stay at Pointe Estero Beach Resort.  We loved the resort and the location to the beach.  The rooms were great, large, airy, and bright.  We booked a Gulf view room, and were pleasently surprised that the balcony gave us a great view of both the Gulf and the ocean.  The rooms were clean, well taken care of.  Service at the hotel was perfect.  Anything we needed was taken care of immediately.  The beach is beautiful.  Great for just walking or finding sea treasures.  The only problem with the beach was you needed to rent the chairs from a private business.  The hotel did not offer any beach chairs right on the beach.  The rentals were expensive.  So either bring a blankets or buy a couple of cheap chairs.  We loved the hotel and…

title: Pointe Estero Resort  What a Wonderful Place!
review: My husband, myself and our 13 year old daughter spent a week at this beautiful resort.  I had stayed at another Sunstream resort in Naples where I was very impressed with the upkeep of the property and looked into this particular resort.  It had almost no bad reviews from any of the past guests.  We were given a room on the 10th floor.  It was spectacular, we had views of the beach and the bay.  The room itself was a plesant surprise and every appliance was in top notch condition.  The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of towels to use for our weeks stay.  The pool was just terrific and the hot tub was just what the doctor ordered to relieve any stress we may have brought with us.  We always found plenty to do.  We  were thrilled at the location of this place because…

title: Disappointed
review: We stayed at the Pointe Estero in early January.  We are return guests having stayed there about 4 times in the past.    The first thing we noticed was the lack of updates with the mattresses.  They were really quite uncomfortable.  The front desk said they were budgeted to be replaced this year and the only option we were given was to put a piece of plywook between the boxspring and mattress for a little support.    Also, a fitness center should not be advertised since the 2 pieces of equipment did not work properly (Proform elliptical and treadmill).  I know they were the same equipment as last year and had the same problems.  The elliptical shut off after 3 minutes requiring to restart all over (programs didn't work either) and the treadmill would not start according to the…

title: Pointe Estero
review: We stayed in Pointe Estero in October of 2003, when renovations were being done, and liked the place, though mice were raiding our kitchens. We rented three condos that year, and one of our group was given a penthouse to make up for the rodent problem.  In October of 2004, we returned to rent 2 gulf front condos. I called several times after a bad hurricane to check that everyone and everything had survived, and that our reservations were still good. I was told without hesitation that 2 gulf front condos awaited us. When we arrived, the staff at the front desk gave us one NON gulf front room, without any explanation. I got the feeling that we were expected not to notice the switch. Finally, after some discussion, we were offered a discount on that room.  The other condo was gulf…

title: The reviews were right!
review: We have just returned from a week at Pointe Estero after a week in Orlando (4 hour drive). I booked this resort based on the reviews from Trip Advisor and I was not dissapointed! The suite was enormous and had absolutely everything we needed including lots of beach and bath towels, 2 tv's, a DVD player and VCR. The jacuzzi was a great touch. There is not much to do at Fort Myers, it is a rather old fashioned beach resort, but if you are looking for a relaxing holiday on a nice, quiet beach this is the place for you. The beach rents sunbeds and umbrellas but it is expensive at $20 till 5pm for 2 beds and an umbrella so I would advise anyone booking this resort to either bring beds with you or buy them when you get there (the local Publix supermarket on Estero blvd sold them for…

title: One of our favorites!
review: Maybe it's the "off season" but we felt like we had the whole place to ourselves.  We had a condo up high facing the Gulf and you can see for miles.  The beach was never crowded, nor was the pool.  We did have to wait once or twice for the tennis court.  The condo is in very good shape, plenty of room and everything you need is here.  We are on our last night of a week stay here and I wish we were staying another week.  It is very peaceful and quiet here.

title: A great stay at Pointe Estero Beach Resort
review: We stayed at this resort from 6/24-26.  We were very pleased with our stay and would stay again.  We had fully expected a sandy beach resort, however, this one was very clean, spacious, and nicely furnished.    We rented a 1 bedroom suite.  The bedroom had a king sized bed and a very large jacquizzi tub in the master bathroom.  My sister slept on the sofa bed in the living room and it was very comfortable.  There was also a second bathroom with a washer/dryer in the closet.  The bathrooms were stocked with plenty of towels including beach towels, blow dryer, etc.     There was a kitchen with all the modern conveniences and a dining room area with a glass dining room table.  There was a nicely furnished living room and the suite had 2  large tv's-one in the bedroom and one in the…

title: wonderful......
review: I have been to florida many times mainly the east coast and i wanted to stay on the west coast and found this wonderful condo...what a wonderful time we all had we had a 2 bedroom beachfront so breathtaking...and to our treat there were 3 weddings that weekend and how wonderful and romantic it was.  The condo was beautiful the only down side was that there was  only one elevator working at the time but was to open the following thursday so it was fine.  The weather was  absolutely wonderful the sunsets spectacular and we did enjoy the south end of the beach better the north looks a little crowded.  For the first time at fort myers beach it  was just wonderful and yes i would go back and stay there.

title: we were given a terrace overlooking the garbage dumpster
review: went to pointe estero in may, 2004............apartment was nice, clean and wonderful beach,,,,,,,,,,,,however when we arrived we were told the only apartment was over the lobby and terrace was over the garbage dumpster.  We had reservations a few weeks ahead and the office said they had no other apartment available.  After a fuss, we did get some $ off the room rates.  Wonderful, warm pool.  Another patron arrived and although she had a reservation, there was some error made and they did not have a place for her.  Staff on duty that day very unprofessional.

title: Pointe Estero has become our retreat
review: I was guided to Pointe Estero by a special travel agent.  I am new to Florida and wanted to look around the Ft. Myers area as a part of vacation.  Started in the Orlando area and ended on Ft. Myers Beach at the beginning of July.  I and my Fiancé liked it so much, we immediately booked for a getaway for early November.  We enjoy the beachfront suites.  Couldn't get the sixth floor this time.  Had to settle on the third.  It was still fantastic.    Pointe Estero is on the southwest end of Ft. Myers Beach which offers less traffic and noise and a more secluded environment.  Walking the beach each morning and spending the afternoons by the pool is just what the doctor ordered.  Local dining is pleasurable.  We've already discovered our favorites.  Although, the suites provided…

title: There is no better place...
review: ...if you`re looking for apartments on a gulf coast beach there is really no better place ! I stayed at Sunstream`s Pointe Estero the 5th time within the last 10 years and I am sure to come again and again :-). The big beach including the powder-fine white sand at the high-rise gulffront building (full gulf view from every unit !) is one of the most beautiful I ever saw and is very clean and well maintained - ideal for small kids. It´s never overcrowded there, because most neighbor buildings are vacation condos or small motels (Outrigger/Holiday Inn nearby). The suite units are huge, fully refurbished with e.g. new carpets, partially new furniture, new kitchen appliances and nice views of the gulf and the beautiful backbay of Ft. Myers Beach. Therefore I prefer the so called…

title: Loved the resort!!!
review: We had four great days at the resort.  It was cut short by Hurricane Charlie.  Our reservation was messed up and we did not have the correct room.  We booked gulf front and were given gulf view.  When we brought it to the staffs' attention we were upgraded to the penthouse.  It was great.   Our only problems were a little mold in the master bath and not much help when we were evacuated. I don't think the evacuation problems were with the staff but are a Florida problem.  No one knew what to do with the tourists.  I hope the resort survived well...we can't wait to go back!

title: What do you expect when you go on vacation during spring break?
review: The Pointe Estero was great. The hotels were spacious and very nice. My family and I have also been tot his hotel many times. We really enjoyed it and have had no problems with it. We had a jacuzi in our room and also 2 bedrooms, living room, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, washer and dryer, and a balcony with a great view. I recomend to go to Sannabelle Island to collect seashells. THe pool is great and the land is very nice. Do you really expect it to be quite during spring break????Duh
